column4: if i have lost my partition table is there a way to get it back?
Yes there is a way but it is a bit difficult.
ok how
what where the partition types? Rather the filesystem types?
Before we get into the way that works but takes about an hour. Please use the LiveCD and boot from that. Then install GPART. It tries to guess which paritions are on the hard disk.
the man page for gpart: http://linux.die.net/man/8/gpart
do i have to use live cd
well, you need a way to boot your computer so you have access to the disk.

or grab the ultimatebootcd and jump in there chan for help. http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&ct=res&cd=1&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ultimatebootcd.com%2F&ei=3wmsRuflC5DQeuGKyfMF&usg=AFQjCNGXFsEb1DhrlxVrZRfWLJ8qogmOdg&sig2=2l8px1W5yFDlAL8zXlUohw
www.ultimatebootcd.com/
but im in linux now and its a secondary disk thats broken
o. that is good.
install gpart
so how is this working
`sudo gpart /dev/hda` or which-ever device you would like.
does this work with sata disk
yes.
but it only seems to support ext2
you are right. It thinks that the ext3 is ext2 but the superblocks are the same.
is gonna take some time right
yes.
i got this http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/31766/ on the gpart scan
ive tried everything now and its gone
